articles.title: Sausage wars: EU and UK agree to extension of chilled meats grace period - thejournal.ie
articles.description: The European Commission has announced solutions to also allow for the movement of medicines, livestock, and guide dogs.
articles.content:

THE UK AND the European Union have agreed to extend a grace period allowing chilled meats to be sent from Great Britain to Northern Ireland until 30 September as well as a number… [+7343 chars]

articles.title: Is there methane on Mars? Scientists close to solving mystery of the gas on Red Planet - India Today
articles.description: While the Curiosity rover had identified methane on the surface, Europe's orbiter hovering over it could not notice any trace in the atmosphere.
articles.content: When it comes to the search of ancient microbial life beyond Earth, Mars has been the closest to having traces of gases and conditions that might support the activity. However, one such gas has puzzl… [+3374 chars]

articles.title: Delta variant leaves southern Europe struggling to save summer tourism - Financial Times
articles.description: Countries must balance welcoming foreign visitors against risk of variant’s rapid spread
articles.content: Southern European countries are in the unenviable position of having to restrict foreign tourism or risk the rapid spread of the Delta coronavirus variant, as economists warn of another disappointing… [+5097 chars]

articles.author: Niamh Quinlan
articles.title: FactCheck: Is Ireland one of the only countries in Europe without indoor dining? - TheJournal.ie
articles.description: The claim was first made last Friday. The Journal FactCheck finds it to be true.
articles.content:
AN IMAGE BEING shared widely on social media in the past few days claims Ireland is one of the only countries in Europe where indoor dining is not currently permitted.
